page.title: 12TRANSPORT - HEDINGHAM
page.content: There is little public transport, no trains within a 10-mile radius, and a limited local bus service. This provides buses to local market towns daily and some services in the early morning in time for work. There is also a service called the Country Car which runs by appointment in the evenings to nearby towns. There are two daily long-distance services which go through the villages, one to London from Sudbury and one from Clacton to Cambridge. There is a private hire mini-bus firm in the village which employs 18 people and has 12 vehicles for hire. The firm caters mainly for regular contract work for schools and local industry all over Essex and Suffolk.
